  "cells": [
    {
      "cell_type": "markdown",
      "source": [
        "## Credit Card Fraud Detection – Task 9\n",
        "\n",
        "This project focuses on detecting fraudulent credit card transactions using machine learning.\n",
        "\n",
        "Since the original dataset was not accessible during execution, a synthetic dataset was generated using `make_classification()` to simulate a real-world fraud scenario with severe class imbalance (99% normal, 1% fraud).\n",
        "\n",
        "The goal is to:\n",
        "- Understand the impact of class imbalance\n",
        "- Train a classification model\n",
        "- Evaluate performance using appropriate metrics"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "lZvtBjTkl5PS"
      }
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "import numpy as np\n",
        "import pandas as pd\n",
        "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
        "import seaborn as sns\n",
        "\n",
        "from sklearn.datasets import make_classification\n",
        "from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split\n",
        "from sklearn.linear_model import LogisticRegression\n",
        "from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score, classification_report, confusion_matrix"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "c0FKpQHckQ_K"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "X, y = make_classification(\n",
        "    n_samples=10000,\n",
        "    n_features=30,\n",
        "    n_informative=10,\n",
        "    n_redundant=10,\n",
        "    n_clusters_per_class=1,\n",
        "    weights=[0.99],      # 99% normal, 1% fraud\n",
        "    flip_y=0,\n",
        "    random_state=42\n",
        ")"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "atQ9DmcVl18b"
      },
      "execution_count": null,
      "outputs": []
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "df = pd.DataFrame(X, columns=[f'V{i}' for i in range(1, 31)])\n",
        "df['Class'] = y\n",
        "\n",
        "df.head()"
      ],

    {
      "cell_type": "markdown",
      "source": [
        "### Class Imbalance\n",
        "\n",
        "The dataset is highly imbalanced, with very few fraud cases compared to normal transactions.\n",
        "In such problems, accuracy can be misleading because a model can predict all transactions as normal and still achieve high accuracy.\n",
        "\n",
        "Therefore, metrics like precision, recall, and F1-score are more reliable for evaluation."
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "id": "ZjDbgB13mhBX"
      }
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "source": [
        "from sklearn.metrics import precision_score, recall_score, f1_score\n",
        "\n",
        "print(\"Precision:\", precision_score(y_test, y_pred))\n",
        "print(\"Recall:\", recall_score(y_test, y_pred))\n",
        "print(\"F1 Score:\", f1_score(y_test, y_pred))"
      ],
      "metadata": {
        "colab": {
